recipe.ingredients: 4 large bell peppers (any color), 1 cup quinoa (uncooked), 2 cups low-sodium vegetable broth, 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 medium onion, chopped, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 zucchini, diced, 1 cup black beans, drained and rinsed, 1 cup corn kernels, fresh or frozen and thawed, 1 teaspoon chili powder, 1 teaspoon cumin, 1/2 teaspoon paprika, Salt and pepper, to taste, 1/2 cup grated low-fat cheddar cheese, Fresh cilantro or parsley for garnish
recipe.directions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut the tops off peppers and remove seeds and membranes. Bring the vegetable broth to a boil in a medium pot. Stir in quinoa, cover, and reduce heat to low. Cook for 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat and set aside, Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and sauté until translucent. Add zucchini, black beans, and corn and cook for another 5 minutes. Add the cooked quinoa to the skillet and mix in chili powder, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper. Stir well to combine, Stuff each bell pepper with the quinoa mixture and place in a baking dish. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes. Remove foil, sprinkle each pepper with cheese, and bake uncovered for another 10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and the peppers are tender. Garnish with fresh cilantro or parsley before serving.
recipe.nutrition: Calories 294, Total fat 8g, Protein 14g, Cholesterol 10mg, Total carbohydrate 45g, Dietary fiber 9g, Monounsaturated fat 3g, Saturated fat 2g, Added sugars 0g, Sodium 312mg, Potassium 740mg, Total sugars 8g
